newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek bourse turnover up 41.33pct mo/mo in Sept.
newsitem.headline: Greek bourse turnover up 41.33pct mo/mo in Sept.

text.p: Turnover at the main market of the Athens bourse rose 41.33 percent or 50.4 million drachmas month-on-month and 103.8 percent year-on-year in September, Ionian Research said in its monthly report.
Turnover at the parallel market was also up 54.4 percent month-on-month in September to 18.8 billion drachmas, it said.
The average monthly marketability of all main market listings rose to 4.42 percent in September from 3.47 percent in August and 3.83 percent in September 1995, it said.

The preferred shares of the Bank of Athens ranked first in terms of marketability among all bank shares at 59.43 percent folowed by common shares of the National Mortgage Bank at 9.15 percent, it said.
